channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #153 - How to get a medal from the Army for writing Perl
item.description:
Hi

while probably due to YAPC there are not so many articles from the usual suspects, there are two from outside the echo-chamber (Rex automation and medal from the Army).

The recorded videos from YAPC::NA are also available and there is a fund-raiser going on to release CMS in Perl.

Enjoy!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: We are Hiring a Senior Perl Software Developer - Grant Street Group
item.description: We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.

item.title: Why Learn Perl? Interview 2 - Andy Beverley, Serial Entrepreneur
item.description: Andrew Solomon keeps interviewing his students at Geekuni.

item.title: First steps in IT automation by Rex Automation Tool
item.description: Unfortunately only the beginning of the article is available free of charge, but I am glad to see Rex, a Perl-based alternative of Puppet and Chef, making into the Admin Magazine.

item.title: How I got a medal from the Army for writing code
item.description: Deployed in Iraq. What can you do with Perl? The same story as told by The Register.

item.title: Perl smartmatch : what now ?
item.description: Laurent Dami raised the frustrating question. You know, the smartmatch operator and the given/when pair that were introduced in perl 5.10 have been marked as experimental in 5.18 and it is not clear how they might change in the future. A few suggestions how to deal with the problem.

item.title: How to Run a Single Test via Dist::Zilla
item.description: Olaf Alders shares a one-liner he saw on #dzil.

item.title: perlsloc - Count Perl Source Lines with Perl::Tidy
item.description: A small shell script using ack, perltidy, xargs, and wc to count the source lines of code in any number of directories.

item.title: Catalyst 'Ancona' : Application Tracing feature
item.description: A Quest and a branch

item.title: 100 days of CPAN releases
item.description: Neil Bowers had this crazy idea of releasing a CPAN module every day. I am really happy that this mostly involved releasing fixes for existing modules. Apparently he now needs help getting his hand on more modules. So if you are a CPAN author who wants to get rid of a module, this might be a good time to contact Neil!

item.title: Liberate a powerful, popular CMS written in Perl to compete with WordPress and create demand for Perl skills.
item.description: Scott Walters is looking to fund further development of WebGUI, the Perl-based Content Management System.

item.title: Grants Committee 2014 first half
item.description: A few notes of Makoto Nozaki, the head of the Grants Committee

item.title: Grants Cancellation
item.description: Both the YACT and, to my great surprise the Pinto grants were canceled. Unfortunately without any explanation.

item.title: Unofficial information about The Perl Foundation Grants
item.description: Collected data about the Grants TPF gave between 2010 and 2014. Including all forms of grants, 'General TPF Grant', 'Perl 5 Core Maintenance Fund', and 'Hague Grants'.

item.title: YAPC::NA 2014 Talk Slides
item.description: Dave Rolsky has posted his slides, including the ones he used for his Intro to Moose class, a lightning talk titled 'Stepford, a Thing Sort of Like Make', and the his Date with Perl.

item.title: YAPC::NA videos
item.description: Last week I had to send a second edition just to let you know about the live feed of the YAPC::NA. It was great to watch some of the talks live but, you probably did not have time to watch all of them. Luckily the videos are already on YouTube and by now they have been added to PerlTV site as well. You can watch them here.

item.title: Computer science for the self taught hacker
item.description: 21 min video overing subject such as 'complexity', big-O notation, sorting algorithms, and more.

item.title: Perl Platform as a Service Shootout
item.description: 22 min video: How easy is it to publish a Perl-based application on Heroku and on dotCloud?

item.title: TPF Year in Review - 2014
item.description: 11 min with Dan Wright, the treasurer of The Perl Foundation.

item.title: What I've been working on, and what's coming up
item.description: Jonathan Worthington, one of the key core developers of Perl 6 who also gives great presentations, gives us some insite into his plans: Asynchronous Bits, MoarVM's dynamic optimizer, JIT Compilation for MoarVM, and various Rakudo fixes an optimizations.

item.title: 2014.25: optimizations, more CPAN, more GSoC, YAPC::NA, and a release.
item.description: The Perl 6 weekly

item.title: MetaCPAN weekly report - RapidApp & Test::RequiresInternet
StackOverflow Perl report
Perl::Dancer Conference 2014
item.description: October 8-9, 2014 in Hancock, NY with two training days before the conference.

item.title: Remnants of a Deeper YAPC
item.description: Buddy Burden nicely tells his story attending YAPC::NA 2014. If you could not attend, but would like to get the feeling a bit, this might be a good starting point.

item.title: Perl-related events
item.description: In the following cities: Granada (ES), Sofia (BG), Tokyo (JP), FlÃ¶rli Olten (CH), Hancock (NY/USA), Salzburg (AT)
